title: Never Forgotten You (Theonsa)
body:
Summary: Sansa had moved away from Theon years ago. And she had moved back and she was ready to see him again. 

Word count: 1.9k

A/N: English is not my first language so I apologize for any mistakes

——————————


She could only remember his name. For years they had been separated and she had slowly forgotten things about him. Like the way he talked. She had only been around 13 when she was forced to move away she had to leave him behind. Now she was 18 and ready to move back to where he lived.

To be honest, he had always been her crush. Ever since she was a little girl and he had come to their home to play with her older brother, she had liked him. But that was the reason she could have never have him, he was her older brothers best friend. But when she had moved away she had grown to not care about that. She had learned that she loved him, and secretly she hoped he loved her back.

She put her last suitcase in her dad’s car when her mom walked up to her. “Sansa,” She said, “Are you sure you’re going to move back there? We left for a reason.”

“And I want to go back for a reason,” Sansa stated.

“What reason?” Her mom asked, “You keep talking about this reason but you never tell us what the reason is.”

“Because you won’t like the reason,” Sansa said, “You’ll tell me it’s stupid and that it is better to stay here. But I’m sure I want to go.” Her mom sighed and hugged her. Sansa hugged her back before her mother whispered in her ear.

“I know it’s for that boy, I hope you find happiness.” Sansa let go of her mother in shock and looked at her with wide eyes. “I always knew you liked him, It was obvious when you looked at him.” Sansa started blushing, what if he knew it too?

“Sansa, sweetheart, are you coming?” Her dad yelled from the car.

“Coming,” Sansa yelled back and she looked at her mom, “If will visit you mom, I promise.”

“I hope you come back with a boyfriend by your side,” Her mom smiled at her and Sansa smiled back.

“I think Robb would murder me,” Sansa laughed and her mom laughed too. Sansa hugged her one last time and then walked over to her dad’s car and got in the car.

“Are you ready?” He asked with the biggest grin on her face and Sansa nodded, “I can’t believe it, my first daughter to move out.”

“Dad, you were less emotional when Robb moved out,” Sansa said.

“Well, he isn’t my oldest daughter,” Her dad said and he started the car. They drove away and Sansa looked out of the window. Finally, she was going to see him again, after all those years. Was he even going to recognize her? Sansa wondered. She hoped he still lived where he used to live.

Robb had moved back to Winterfell years ago. He had told Sansa he had a roommate but never told who. It only came to Sansa now it might be Theon. That would be awkward. What would she have to say to Robb if she told him she was visiting Theon. He would be mad, he was already mad when Joffery flirted with her in front of him. But Theon wasn’t Joffery. And Robb knew Theon.

When they finally arrived at the apartment Sansa had bought she couldn’t wait until her father left and she could search for Theon. But her dad insisted on helping her unpack her stuff.

Sansa’s roommate, Margaery, had lived in the place for a year now so there was already furniture. She used to live there with her brother, but he had moved in with his boyfriend not long ago.

“Sansa,” Margaery greeted her, “Mr.Stark nice to meet you.”

“Margaery,” Sansa’s dad said happily, “Oh I remember in high school when your dad and I were friends. Lovely to see our daughters are friends too now.” Sansa and Margaery looked at each other and they both chuckled.

“Dad I can handle it on my own now,” Sansa said.

“But I want to help,” Sansa’s dad insisted again and Sansa looked at Margaery for help.

“I think I’m going to show Sansa around town a little,” Margaery said, “A lot has changed in 5 years, why don’t you come back tomorrow, then we’ll unpack. You can bring Catelyn too.”

Ned nodded and kissed Sansa on her cheek, “Have fun, I’ll see you tomorrow,” He said and he left the apartment.

“Do you know where he lives?” Was the first thing Sansa asked as soon as Ned left and Margaery chuckled again.

“I don’t,” Margaery said and Sansa sighed disappointed and looked at the ground, “But I do know where his sister lives, she must know where he lives.” Sansa looked up again, looking much happier. “Let’s go.”

The girls left the apartment while Sansa kept asking Margaery stuff about Theon. “Sansa, I don’t know Theon well,” Margaery said when they had almost arrived at Yara’s house, “I know his sister, Yara.”

Once they arrived Margaery knocked at the door. A girl opened the door and Sansa was sure it wasn’t Theon sister. She hadn’t seen Yara a lot but she was sure she didn’t have white hair. “Do you know Yara?”

“Yeah,” The girl smiled, “She is my friend. I’m Daenerys.” Sansa smiled at her and Daenerys smiled back, “Do you want something from her?”

“We just want to know where her brother lives,” Margaery said.

“I’ll go and get her,” Daenerys said and she walked away. Soon enough Yara came back.

“Sansa?” She said surprised, “Is that you, you’ve grown so much!”

“Well, that happens in five years,” Sansa laughed, “Do you know where Theon lives, I assume he doesn’t live at home anymore.”

“You don’t know he lives with Robb?” Yara asked and Sansa let out a little ‘I knew it’ making Margaery and Yara chuckle, “I think you know where Robb lives.”

“I know, thank you,” Sansa said and Yara smiled at her before closing the door. Margaery and Sansa walked away from Yara’s house and went over to Robb’s which wasn’t far away.

“I can’t believe he never told us,” Sansa ranted to Margaery.

“Maybe he wanted to surprise you,” Margaery said, “It sure was a surprise for me when I found out my brother was going to live together with my old crush.”

“But Loras and Renly are dating,” Sansa said, “And besides Robb has a girlfriend.”

“You can have a relationship with three people,” Margaery said and Sansa looked at her with an eyebrow raised. “What? I’ll never do it.”

Once they arrived at Robbs house Sansa was the one to knock on the door. Again, a girl opened. “Sansa!” She said happily and Sansa assumed this was Talisa. Robb and Talisa had met not long after Robb moved back to Winterfell. “Robb told so much about you.”

“He also told me a lot about you,” Sansa smiled.

“Come in,”  Talisa said and she let the girls in, “Robb and Theon are gone but they can be back any moment. Do you want anything to drink?” Sansa sat down on the couch and looked at Talisa.

“Uh no,” She said and Talisa and Margaery both sat down next to her. They talked for a few more minutes before they heard the door close.

Sansa could hear Robb’s voice getting closer and she stood up. As soon as Robb walked into the living room he stopped. “Sansa!” He said happily and they walked over to each other to hug. “How are you? How is Arya? And Bran? And Rickon?”

“They’re good, I’m good,” Sansa said and the two let go of each other.

“Sansa?” Sansa looked past Robb at Theon. He looked surprised to see her here but he was smiling.

“Theon,” Sansa said and she walked over to him. The two stared at each other before hugging.

“You look beautiful,” Theon whispered in Sansa’s ear and Sansa started blushing. Robb faked coughed and Sansa could hear Margaery and Talisa chuckle. Sansa and Theon let go of each other. “Let’s go for a walk, just you and me,” Theon suggested and Sansa nodded. Before Robb could say anything Theon and Sansa were outside.

“When did you move back here?” Was the first thing Theon asked when they started walking.

“Today,” Sansa said, “Five whole years of not being here and I wanted to go back.”

“You’re a lot like your brother,” Theon said, “He said the same, that he wanted to go back.” It stayed silent between the two for a moment before Theon spoke again, “You’ve really grown more beautiful in five years.” Sansa started blushing again and Theon chuckled.

“And you’ve grown more handsome in five years,” Sansa teased him and she swore she saw him blush too. Sansa also chuckled and Theon smiled at her. And when she looked back at him it was like all those feelings from the past years came back at once.

“How’s life?” Sansa asked.

“It’s alright,” Theon said, “I’m kinda jealous of your brother and Talisa. I used to have a girlfriend you know, but she broke up with me.”

“Really?” Sansa asked, “You had a girlfriend?” It hurt her to ask that but she could have known it. Of course she wasn’t the only one with a crush on Theon. And he could like people back.

“Yeah, but not for that long,” Theon said, “I don’t even know if I really liked her or if it was just to prove to my sister I could get one.”

“Does Yara have a boyfriend?”

“No, she does have a girlfriend,” Theon said and Sansa looked confused, “Daenerys, come on, you visited her, you must have seen her.”

“She introduced herself to me as Yara’s friend,” Sansa said.

“She is kinda scared,” Theon said, “She came out to her brother and he abandoned her. So now she is scared other people might do too.”

“Well, the next time I see her I’ll tell her I’m not one of those people,” Sansa said and Theon smiled.

“Do you have a boyfriend?” Theon then asks Sansa.

“I had one, Joffery,” Sansa said and Theon groaned, “He was horrible, always abused me. My dad had to stop the relationship because I couldn’t. I still loved him somehow.”

Theon stopped walking and so did Sansa. “You still loved him even though he abused you?”

“I read it’s normal.” Theon walked forward and grabbed Sansa’s hand.

“If someone ever abuses you again come to me,” He said, “If will help you.” Sansa looked at her hand which Theon was holding and soon felt his other hand putting her hair behind her ear.

“I liked you when we were younger,” Theon then says, “And I thought I had forgotten you, but I have never forgotten you. When I saw you again, everything came back.” Sansa looked at Theon and smiled.

“Theon,” She started, but Theon interrupted her.

“Nevermind that, I don’t know what I’m talking about,” He quickly says, “Let’s go back to Robb and.”

“I liked you too,” Sansa says, “And I had the same thing, I still like you Theon.” Theon looks at Sansa for a moment and then kisses her. It was the first kiss for Sansa with someone that she liked and someone who liked her. And it felt good, way different than with Joffery.

They let go of each other and just smiled at each other before they heard Robbs voice yell their names in a not so happy way.

“You can have a relationship with three people,” Margaery said and Sansa looked at her with an eyebrow raised. “What? I’ll never do it.”

Once they arrived at Robbs house Sansa was the one to knock on the door. Again, a girl opened. “Sansa!” She said happily and Sansa assumed this was Talisa. Robb and Talisa had met not long after Robb moved back to Winterfell. “Robb told so much about you.”

“He also told me a lot about you,” Sansa smiled.

“Come in,”  Talisa said and she let the girls in, “Robb and Theon are gone but they can be back any moment. Do you want anything to drink?” Sansa sat down on the couch and looked at Talisa.

“Uh no,” She said and Talisa and Margaery both sat down next to her. They talked for a few more minutes before they heard the door close.

Sansa could hear Robb’s voice getting closer and she stood up. As soon as Robb walked into the living room he stopped. “Sansa!” He said happily and they walked over to each other to hug. “How are you? How is Arya? And Bran? And Rickon?”

“They’re good, I’m good,” Sansa said and the two let go of each other.

“Sansa?” Sansa looked past Robb at Theon. He looked surprised to see her here but he was smiling.

“Theon,” Sansa said and she walked over to him. The two stared at each other before hugging.

“You look beautiful,” Theon whispered in Sansa’s ear and Sansa started blushing. Robb faked coughed and Sansa could hear Margaery and Talisa chuckle. Sansa and Theon let go of each other. “Let’s go for a walk, just you and me,” Theon suggested and Sansa nodded. Before Robb could say anything Theon and Sansa were outside.

“When did you move back here?” Was the first thing Theon asked when they started walking.

“Today,” Sansa said, “Five whole years of not being here and I wanted to go back.”

“You’re a lot like your brother,” Theon said, “He said the same, that he wanted to go back.” It stayed silent between the two for a moment before Theon spoke again, “You’ve really grown more beautiful in five years.” Sansa started blushing again and Theon chuckled.

“And you’ve grown more handsome in five years,” Sansa teased him and she swore she saw him blush too. Sansa also chuckled and Theon smiled at her. And when she looked back at him it was like all those feelings from the past years came back at once.

“How’s life?” Sansa asked.

“It’s alright,” Theon said, “I’m kinda jealous of your brother and Talisa. I used to have a girlfriend you know, but she broke up with me.”

“Really?” Sansa asked, “You had a girlfriend?” It hurt her to ask that but she could have known it. Of course she wasn’t the only one with a crush on Theon. And he could like people back.

“Yeah, but not for that long,” Theon said, “I don’t even know if I really liked her or if it was just to prove to my sister I could get one.”

“Does Yara have a boyfriend?”

“No, she does have a girlfriend,” Theon said and Sansa looked confused, “Daenerys, come on, you visited her, you must have seen her.”

“She introduced herself to me as Yara’s friend,” Sansa said.

“She is kinda scared,” Theon said, “She came out to her brother and he abandoned her. So now she is scared other people might do too.”

“Well, the next time I see her I’ll tell her I’m not one of those people,” Sansa said and Theon smiled.

“Do you have a boyfriend?” Theon then asks Sansa.

“I had one, Joffery,” Sansa said and Theon groaned, “He was horrible, always abused me. My dad had to stop the relationship because I couldn’t. I still loved him somehow.”

Theon stopped walking and so did Sansa. “You still loved him even though he abused you?”

“I read it’s normal.” Theon walked forward and grabbed Sansa’s hand.

“If someone ever abuses you again come to me,” He said, “If will help you.” Sansa looked at her hand which Theon was holding and soon felt his other hand putting her hair behind her ear.

“I liked you when we were younger,” Theon then says, “And I thought I had forgotten you, but I have never forgotten you. When I saw you again, everything came back.” Sansa looked at Theon and smiled.

“Theon,” She started, but Theon interrupted her.

“Nevermind that, I don’t know what I’m talking about,” He quickly says, “Let’s go back to Robb and.”

“I liked you too,” Sansa says, “And I had the same thing, I still like you Theon.” Theon looks at Sansa for a moment and then kisses her. It was the first kiss for Sansa with someone that she liked and someone who liked her. And it felt good, way different than with Joffery.

They let go of each other and just smiled at each other before they heard Robbs voice yell their names in a not so happy way.

Summary: Sansa had moved away from Theon years ago. And she had moved back and she was ready to see him again. 

Word count: 1.9k

A/N: English is not my first language so I apologize for any mistakes

——————————


She could only remember his name. For years they had been separated and she had slowly forgotten things about him. Like the way he talked. She had only been around 13 when she was forced to move away she had to leave him behind. Now she was 18 and ready to move back to where he lived.

To be honest, he had always been her crush. Ever since she was a little girl and he had come to their home to play with her older brother, she had liked him. But that was the reason she could have never have him, he was her older brothers best friend. But when she had moved away she had grown to not care about that. She had learned that she loved him, and secretly she hoped he loved her back.

She put her last suitcase in her dad’s car when her mom walked up to her. “Sansa,” She said, “Are you sure you’re going to move back there? We left for a reason.”

“And I want to go back for a reason,” Sansa stated.

“What reason?” Her mom asked, “You keep talking about this reason but you never tell us what the reason is.”

“Because you won’t like the reason,” Sansa said, “You’ll tell me it’s stupid and that it is better to stay here. But I’m sure I want to go.” Her mom sighed and hugged her. Sansa hugged her back before her mother whispered in her ear.

“I know it’s for that boy, I hope you find happiness.” Sansa let go of her mother in shock and looked at her with wide eyes. “I always knew you liked him, It was obvious when you looked at him.” Sansa started blushing, what if he knew it too?

“Sansa, sweetheart, are you coming?” Her dad yelled from the car.

“Coming,” Sansa yelled back and she looked at her mom, “If will visit you mom, I promise.”

“I hope you come back with a boyfriend by your side,” Her mom smiled at her and Sansa smiled back.

“I think Robb would murder me,” Sansa laughed and her mom laughed too. Sansa hugged her one last time and then walked over to her dad’s car and got in the car.

“Are you ready?” He asked with the biggest grin on her face and Sansa nodded, “I can’t believe it, my first daughter to move out.”

“Dad, you were less emotional when Robb moved out,” Sansa said.

“Well, he isn’t my oldest daughter,” Her dad said and he started the car. They drove away and Sansa looked out of the window. Finally, she was going to see him again, after all those years. Was he even going to recognize her? Sansa wondered. She hoped he still lived where he used to live.

Robb had moved back to Winterfell years ago. He had told Sansa he had a roommate but never told who. It only came to Sansa now it might be Theon. That would be awkward. What would she have to say to Robb if she told him she was visiting Theon. He would be mad, he was already mad when Joffery flirted with her in front of him. But Theon wasn’t Joffery. And Robb knew Theon.

When they finally arrived at the apartment Sansa had bought she couldn’t wait until her father left and she could search for Theon. But her dad insisted on helping her unpack her stuff.

Sansa’s roommate, Margaery, had lived in the place for a year now so there was already furniture. She used to live there with her brother, but he had moved in with his boyfriend not long ago.

“Sansa,” Margaery greeted her, “Mr.Stark nice to meet you.”

“Margaery,” Sansa’s dad said happily, “Oh I remember in high school when your dad and I were friends. Lovely to see our daughters are friends too now.” Sansa and Margaery looked at each other and they both chuckled.

“Dad I can handle it on my own now,” Sansa said.

“But I want to help,” Sansa’s dad insisted again and Sansa looked at Margaery for help.

“I think I’m going to show Sansa around town a little,” Margaery said, “A lot has changed in 5 years, why don’t you come back tomorrow, then we’ll unpack. You can bring Catelyn too.”

Ned nodded and kissed Sansa on her cheek, “Have fun, I’ll see you tomorrow,” He said and he left the apartment.

“Do you know where he lives?” Was the first thing Sansa asked as soon as Ned left and Margaery chuckled again.

“I don’t,” Margaery said and Sansa sighed disappointed and looked at the ground, “But I do know where his sister lives, she must know where he lives.” Sansa looked up again, looking much happier. “Let’s go.”

The girls left the apartment while Sansa kept asking Margaery stuff about Theon. “Sansa, I don’t know Theon well,” Margaery said when they had almost arrived at Yara’s house, “I know his sister, Yara.”

Once they arrived Margaery knocked at the door. A girl opened the door and Sansa was sure it wasn’t Theon sister. She hadn’t seen Yara a lot but she was sure she didn’t have white hair. “Do you know Yara?”

“Yeah,” The girl smiled, “She is my friend. I’m Daenerys.” Sansa smiled at her and Daenerys smiled back, “Do you want something from her?”

“We just want to know where her brother lives,” Margaery said.

“I’ll go and get her,” Daenerys said and she walked away. Soon enough Yara came back.

“Sansa?” She said surprised, “Is that you, you’ve grown so much!”

“Well, that happens in five years,” Sansa laughed, “Do you know where Theon lives, I assume he doesn’t live at home anymore.”

“You don’t know he lives with Robb?” Yara asked and Sansa let out a little ‘I knew it’ making Margaery and Yara chuckle, “I think you know where Robb lives.”

“I know, thank you,” Sansa said and Yara smiled at her before closing the door. Margaery and Sansa walked away from Yara’s house and went over to Robb’s which wasn’t far away.

“I can’t believe he never told us,” Sansa ranted to Margaery.

summary: It has been a long time since I’ve read AFFC so any specific recollection of “Alayne’s“ chapters are a bit blurry. But, with...
question: It has been a long time since I’ve read AFFC so any specific recollection of “Alayne’s“ chapters are a bit blurry. But, with Alayne/Sansa planning to marry Harry the Heir, how will Cissy or Saffron feel about that? I’m ashamed to admit that I can’t remember much of their feelings (if they were even described). Will they be angry or jealous? Do they still love Harry? Especially Saffron since I believe she’s still pregnant with his child. Or do they not care? Would Sansa befriend them?.... etc.
answer:
I don’t know if we’ll see much if anything of Cissy, sadly. All Harry mentioned of her was that “Lady Anya arranged for her to marry one of her men-at-arms”. Presumably, that means, Cissy lives somewhere around Ironoaks; it’s possible Sansa and company will make a stop at Ironoaks on their way to Gulltown and then back north, though the limited number of chapters I suspect Sansa (and to varying degrees everyone else) will have perhaps undermines the likelihood of stopping to see Cissy. Sadly, Cissy may fall into the same narrative obscurity as Mya Stone’s (nameless!) mother, the lowborn servant mother of an unfaithful lordling’s daughter.

Saffron may be slightly more likely, if only because I think it’s very likely Sansa’s story takes her to Gulltown, where Saffron’s father is reportedly “the richest man” in the city. (It’s worth noting that I don’t know where Saffron herself is living right now; the sample chapter mentioned Harry potentially “send[ing] [Saffron] back” to Gulltown, but didn’t mention further.) It could be very interesting to see that dynamic: Saffron’s own personality and feelings toward the man who abandoned her for his new, even richer fiancée; Saffron’s father’s reaction to Harry, Sansa, and his daughter’s pregnancy (would he be furious at Harry for “soiling” the daughter “more precious to him than gold”, ambitious to look for advantages for the bastard child of the (presumably by that point) Lord of the Eyrie, or something else?); and Sansa’s seeing in the flesh the proof of Harry’s faithlessness (especially when she coyly told Harry that he’d have to “send Saffron back to her father” when they wed)

summary: Sansa sat up. "Lady," she whispered. For a moment it was as if the direwolf was there in the room, looking at her with those...
body:
Sansa sat up. “Lady,” she whispered. For a moment it was as if the direwolf was there in the room, looking at her with those golden eyes, sad and knowing. She had been dreaming, she realized. Lady was with her, and they were running together, and … and … trying to remember was like trying to catch the rain with her fingers. The dream faded, and lady was dead again.

Sansa III, A Game of Thrones

Lady was with her, and they were running together, and … and … trying to remember was like trying to catch the rain with her fingers. The dream faded, and lady was dead again.

Sansa III, A Game of Thrones

summary: One of my favorite things as of late is slowly seeing people wake the fuck up and see how jonsa isn't all that great. Based on...
question: One of my favorite things as of late is slowly seeing people wake the fuck up and see how jonsa isn't all that great. Based on season 8, it would be rather horrible. The last thing sansa needs is to be in  a relationship where she's doing all the work and ESPECIALLY carrying all the emotional labor. She also needs someone who sees how brilliant and how good of  politican/ leader she is. Tho, I have seen ppl kinda romanticize that, Sansa being all jon needs and him giving her nothing in return
answer: I don’t see what people find appealing about it anymore. I mean in a general sense, it’s already not an interesting ship. There’s nothing remotely dynamic or unique about Jon. Not only that, but he treats her poorly and doesn’t really respect Sansa. Jon not only never truly considers her opinions or her council, but he often even puts what she brings to the table down. He told her that she sounds like she admires the woman that literally abused her. He was willing to use the past tension between Sansa and Arya to his advantage. He only cares about her opinion when it validates him and what he’s doing but the moment she (a feminine woman) has her own opinions, she no longer has any worth to him. He even was complicit in Daenerys’s genocide of King’s Landing (and justified it as well) and literally was about let her do the same to the rest of the world including the North (he would have if it wasn’t for Tyrion urging him). Not only has Jon being terrible to her, but as you said, he’s a mediocre leader (especially because he doesn’t consider anyone’s opinion but his own) and all the responsibility ends up falling in her hands, and she is left having to fix things whenever he messes up (ex: had to keep the Northern Lords on their side, had to regain Northern Independence, etc). Sansa may not always have agreed with Jon and some of the things he does, but she has gone above and beyond for him…while he can’t even let her finish saying what she wants to say at a damn meeting.

summary: No matter how hard you try to throw Daenerys under the bus, your fave Sansa will never be 1/4 of the woman Daenerys was. You...
question: No matter how hard you try to throw Daenerys under the bus, your fave Sansa will never be 1/4 of the woman Daenerys was. You Sansa stans don’t know how to support your fave in peace, without attempting to try to put her on the same level as Daenerys. She will never be on the sane level. Accept that lol. You have to force her onto people for them to give a damn about her.
answer: Yes, Sansa will never be ¼ of the woman that Daenerys was. She’ll never colonize any city for her own gain. She’ll never tear apart that continent economically and socially only to abandon it when she gets bored or can’t benefit from it anymore. She’ll never threaten to kill or actually kill people in order to gain power or to drive fear into a population. She’ll never be incoherent in her decision-making as Daenerys was, nor she will be as incompetent a ruler as her. She’ll also never murder half a million people. Instead, Sansa was, is and will be for the rest of her days her own woman. A woman whose rule is held by the respect her people hold for her as a leader. A woman who has kept her morals and her integrity despite all the horrible things that have happened to her. A woman who will be remembered as the ‘’good’’ queen, not the ‘’mad’’ queen like your fave. Also…‘’the same woman that Daenerys was’’…yes ‘’was’’ because Daenerys is dead and rotting while my fave is the Queen in the North. We LOVE winning, don’t we?
